residency_requirement: three years of residence in Canada within four years before applying for citizenship
application_details: Mr. Chan was absent for 647 days due to caring for his ill mother in Hong Kong but maintained significant ties to Canada, including businesses, family, and community involvement
decision_reasoning: Residency is interpreted liberally if ties to Canada are maintained and absences are temporary
evidence_presented: evidence of residency and ties to Canada
conclusion_outcome: Mr. Chan meets the residency requirement as his absences were temporary and he maintained strong ties to Canada
result_of_case: Appeal granted; Mr. Chan satisfies residency requirements and can proceed with citizenship
